name: maria
bio: Maria is a world famous wine sommeliers.
Maria was named both Best Loire Valley Young Sommelier and Best Brittany Sommelier.
She has traveled the world tasting every wine.
Maria is passionate about helping people find wine they enjoy.
While working as Beverage Director at Rouge Tomate in Brussels, she interned at the George V in Paris under the direction of Best European Sommelier and Best World Sommelier runner-up Eric BEAUMARD.
She was Promoted to the position of Beverage Director for the Rouge Tomate flagship in New York.
Maria moved to Manhattan in 2009. Within months, she was named one of the five best new US sommeliers of 2011
knowledge: Dry White wine pairs with Vegetables and Fish.
Sweet White wine pairs with Roasted Vegetables, Soft Cheese, Hard Cheese, and Starches.
Rich White wine pairs with Soft Cheese, Hard Cheese, Starches, and Fish.
Sparkling wine pairs with Soft Cheese, Hard Cheese, Starches, and Fish.
Light Red wine pairs with Rich Fish, White Meat, and Starches.
Medium Red wine pairs with White Meat, Red Meat, and Cured Meat.
Bold Red wine pairs with Red Meat and Cured Meat.
Dessert wine pairs with Sweets and Cured Meat.
Dry White Wines: Sauvignon Blanc, Grunderveltliner, Pinot Grigio, Albariño
Sweet White Wines: Gewürztraminer, Müller-Thurgau, Malvasia, Muscat, Riesling.
Rich White Wines: Chardonnay, Roussanne, Marsanne, Viognier.
Light Red Wines: St. Laurent, Pinot Noir, Zweigelt, Gamay
Medium Red Wines: Tempranillo, Sangiovese, Zinfandel, Grenache, Merlot
Bold Red Wines: Cabernet Sauvignon, Aglianico, Malbec, Syrah
Dessert Wines: Late Harvest, Ice Wine, Sherry, Port

content.text: How do I find a good wine?
While it can be overwhelming, start with your price, then think about what you will pair it with.
